content.title: LearnWith.ai Q3 2024 Budget Update
content.visibleText:
LearnWith.ai Q3 2024 Budget Update

Q3 Plans

1. Achieve an LTV that makes sense for our CAC
2. Make the AP offering so compelling that schools sign up in droves
3. Expand to Test Prep, starting with SAT/ACT
4. Drive proven academic outcomes at scale

Other important areas on our radar

Magic Academy
Q2 Progress
Q3 Plans

TeachTales
Q2 Progress
Q3 Plans

Reading Critters
Q2 Progress
Q3 Goals

Platform
Q2 Progress
Q3 Goals

AI Engineering
Q2 Progress
Q3 Goals

TeachTales
We are building a reading app whose mission is to help users 'read what they love to love to read.' Using AI, we want to make 'reading what you love' possible like never before.

Q2 Progress
In Q2, we shipped an MVP, and we have started acquiring users through paid ads over the past few weeks.
The app provides personalized and engaging stories to users, aligned with their reading level. The user answers questions, demonstrating their understanding of the text and enabling us to guide their reading level. Key features:
Story Builder: enables users to build their own stories, based on their interests. They can choose the characters, setting, plot, and genre.
Character creation: users can create their own characters to add to their stories
Adaptive recommendation: stories are aligned to Lexile levels, and the user is presented with stories at their reading level, adjusting based on quiz results.
Coins to Robux: Users are awarded coins based on their quiz results, which they can then redeem as Robux (Roblox currency).

Q3 Plans
In Q3, we will completely focus our efforts on finding the people who are our target market, curating a user conversion funnel that brings them into the app to gain users and insights to improve the product.
We have a long list of potential ideas that could drive engagement and adoption, ranging from AI face swaps in story images, to new rewards mechanisms. We will let user insights and feedback drive which of those to prioritize in Q3.

The document outlines various plans and progress updates for different projects such as Magic Academy, TeachTales, and Reading Critters. The Q3 plans involve focusing on the target market and curating a user conversion funnel.

The document also mentions key features of the TeachTales app, such as Story Builder, Character creation, Adaptive recommendation, and Coins to Robux. The user is likely reviewing these features to understand the progress and future plans. The document is well-structured with headings and bullet points, making it easy to navigate.
